header: This is a 16-second music video edit across 23 segments. The goal was a high-energy, tightly synced cut, but the library's lack of peak intensity forced some structural compromises.

advisor.hero: The library is starving for real heat; I had to fake the intensity because the footage just wasn't there to back up the track.
advisor.body: The library health report flagged a 'scarcity_medium_energy' status and a total lack of payoff shots. I had to lean on 'pacing_relentless' and 'sync_tightly_synced' disciplines to bridge the gap where the 'intensity' motifs were missing.

friction_log: Start: High confidence in the technical setup and initial atmospheric build.
Middle: Confidence dipped as I realized the 'intensity' motifs were missing, forcing me to prioritize pacing over content.
End: Finished strong on rhythm, but the lack of aggressive payoff shots left the final impact feeling thin.

post_mortem.worked: The relentless pacing and tight sync kept the momentum alive despite the footage gaps.
post_mortem.didnt: The edit lacks a true emotional payoff because the library was missing high-energy 'intensity' shots.

next_steps: Source high-intensity payoff shots to replace the structural placeholders in the mid-section.
Expand the library to include more medium-energy clips to avoid repetitive filler usage.
Review the 'intensity' motif requirements to ensure future captures meet the edit's technical needs.
technical: Applied a filmic commercial LUT to unify the disparate library clips.
Maintained a relentless pacing strategy to mask the lack of visual variety.
Ensured every cut was tightly synced to the audio transients for maximum rhythmic impact.
